h:head.h:title: OSCE_GNM_2nd Year Nursing_Assisting the patient with oral care

select1.label: Goal: The patient's mouth and teeth will be clean; the patient will exhibit a positive body image; and the patient will verbalize the importance of oral care. Identify the patient. Explain procedure to the patient.
Perform hand hygiene. Put on disposable gloves if assisting with oral care.
Assemble equipment on an over bed table within the patient's reach.
Lower side rail and assist the patient to sitting position if permitted, or turn the patient onto side. Place towel across the patient's chest. Raise bed to a comfortable working position

Encourage the patient to brush his/her own teeth, or assist if necessary. - Moisten the toothbrush and apply toothpaste to bristles. - Place the brush at a 45-degree angle to the gum line and brush from the gum line to the crown of each too. Brush outer and inner surfaces. Brush back and forth across the biting surface of each tooth. - Brush the tongue gently with the toothbrush. - Have the patient rinse vigorously with water and spit into the emesis basin. Repeat until clear. Suction may be used as an alternative for removal of fluid and secretions from mouth.

Assist the patient to floss teeth, if appropriate: a. Remove approximately 6″ of dental floss from container or use a plastic floss holder. Wrap the floss around the index fingers, keeping about 1″ to 1.5″ of floss taut between the fingers. b. Insert floss gently between teeth, moving it back and forth downward to the gums. c. Move the floss up and down first on one side of a tooth and then on the side of the other tooth, until the surfaces are clean. Repeat in the spaces between all teeth. d. Instruct patient to rinse mouth well with water after flossing.
Offer lip balm or petroleum jelly.
Remove equipment. Remove gloves and discard. Raise side rail and lower bed. Assist the patient to a position of comfort.
